Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Best Price, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: m j
Reviews.Content: Honestly I wasnt expecting much from this hotel, I had read the reviews and it seemed to be good compared to the other hotels in our price range. Simple, clean, friendly staff etc is all you need for a good holiday and your not exactly going to be spending day and night in your room! Myself and a friend booked in for 7 nights in the Americanna Inn, on arrival it just looks like and apartment block. Inside its clean, simple and altogether all you need for a trip to the city. We where a bit dubious about the shared bathrooms, but with 10 rooms on each floor and 5 bathrooms we never had a problem with queing or them being dirty. Cleaners came into our rooms everyday and made our beds and did the floor etc, all very friendly. The staff on the desk are all lovely too and very helpful! The rooms themselves are big enough for 2, not huge but enough space with a sink, TV and wardrobe area, we had a/c in our room but I dont think they all do, ask if its warm as the rooms do get hot. If Im being picky, the only thing I would say was becuase our room was on the main road it was noisy during the night even though the windows are double glazed, but then you are in New York so its to be expected. The location is ideal, 2 blocks to the left is the Empire State Building and right next to 5th ave and Times Square. Also the deli just across the road (Bryant Market) is good if you want some cheap hot food. WOULD DEFINATLY STAY HERE AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Great clean place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Ryan S
Reviews.Content: There isn't much to say about this one really as it's a bit basic. The staff were friendly enough and helpful although we didn't ask them much other than an airport shuttle which they sorted promptly and with a smile. We had a private double room with a shared bathroom both of which were A1 clean! The bedroom was a little small but perfectly equipped with A/C (not that we needed it in November) TV, closet and safe. The Hotel was in a great location five minutes walk to times square and five minutes walk to the empire state building in the other direction. 100% recommend great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget choice close to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Greencloud12
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just as I expected after reading the reviews listed on trip advisor. It's basic & minimal but does the job for a clean and decent place to crash after a long day exploring the city. The reception staff were all nice and helpful. I stayed in a single room which was very small but this was expected! However I had no problem fitting in a large suitcase + you have the cupboard space with hangers & rail. The flatscreen TV was also great. The rooms were a little too hot but better than being too cold. My room backed onto a building site which was extremely loud at 7am every morning which was a bit of a pain. Also the hotel is just that little bit too creaky/old so when the couple in a surrounding room is having a little fun it's very very loud for you....not so enjoyable! Overall a good place to stay if you are on a budget & don't mind some basic accommodation. It doesn't really have a hotel feel to it, more like a hostel but I'd recommend it & return again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Close”
Reviews.Author: nathant64
Reviews.Content: A friend and I returned to the Americana Inn because it is so close to Times Square and it is one of the better priced places. Yes, bathrooms are shared, but there is one bathroom to every three rooms - it's either next door or just a step across the hall. We never once encountered the one next door occupied or needing to be cleaned, but there were more within 20 steps down the hall. Yes, the room has linoleum tile in the bedroom, but the room is clean. The blinds are a bit thrashed and didn't work in our room, so there was more light in there at night and early morning than we'd have liked. You have no control over the room temperature. You will need ear plugs to block out the street noise which continues all through the night. Yes, the room is small, but there is a sink and mirror in the room. There is a closet (but no hangers in ours), the pillow was a little too dense, and the bed is just ok. There was a collapsible luggage stand in the closet, a small bedstand with a phone, and a slim-line TV on the wall (we never even considered turning it on). We were there simply for a place to sleep that was conveniently close to the theater district. Did I mention that the place is clean? The idea of shared bathrooms made me nervous initially, but they were kept clean. The place looks and smells clean, and the staff is very friendly. There is no wi-fi in the rooms, but there is a computer with internet access in the lobby that is available for a fee. I managed to get wi-fi access in the lobby for my laptop. This place is no more than a 10-minute walk from Times Square. If you're on a budget, look into this place!

Reviews.Title: “minimum needed”
Reviews.Author: doudlie G
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in november 2011 It gave us the opportunity to stay one more night in New York at a lower price (we were logging at the DoubleTree the night before). It was clean and the staff was nice and helpful. We had the minimum we needed to stay one more night in New York. The rooms are little (no queen bed available, the rooms are too small) but clean. There was a personnal sink in the room but shared bathroom, wich were cleaned when we used them. It was very noisy, more if you are close to the elevator wich makes a "beep" every time somebody arrives (we asked to change room when we realised this, and the staff was very accomodating). The location is perfect to go to Time Square and around. The elevaror is very small, the entree also... it was quite an experience to stay a night there, but defenitly worth it for its strenghs, wich are, for me, the great location and the price. We were disapointed with the parking just in front of the Hotel that charged us more than they told us when we arrived and had no choice to pay... since they got our car and were not open to discuss/negociate. Be careful with the parking deal!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot right in the middle of the giant named New York”
Reviews.Author: voyou7
Reviews.Content: This place offers an impeccable location. Service is prompt and professional. Exccelent slleep and go spot. i ll come back here

Reviews.Title: “Glad I stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: niviapr
Reviews.Content: I was very reluctant to stay at a "Hotel" with a share bathroom, but was within a budget. Once I got to the hotel I noticed how clean it was, the convenience of the location of the bathrooms, with in 10 steps of each room and the attentions of the staff made my experience great. Even though the bathroom floor was, only on a spot between the toilet and the sink, soaked. The bathroom was clean, not smelly at all. The hotel even has a luggage room where you can leave your luggage after you check out for the day, internet access at a fare price, the downside is the lack of WiFi connection. But the location is the most important point of this hotel, just three street blocks from time square. I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price!”
Reviews.Author: JulD
Reviews.Content: I stayed there again this year and enjoyed my stay. We stayed on the fifth floor this time and it was more quiet. The room was very clean and comfortable, maybe a bit small. The shared bath are very clean. Very well located!! Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “When all you need is a room to sleep in”
Reviews.Author: Cahaasman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly as advertised... Nothing more and nothing less. I think that is all one can ask for. Check in was a breeze. M wife and I went straight to our roo which was literally a room with a bed that was slightly smaller than the room, a closet and a sink to was up. We were right next to the bathroom and never had a conflict with other guests over use of the bathroom. There are several bathrooms on each floor. It was noisy at night but it is NYC! Finally, we parked across the street where Americana Inn validated our ticket and we only had to pay $30 per day which included tax. This place was perfect for us as we only wanted a place to stay since we were exploring the city all day. The room was very nice and relaxing to return to for the evening. Location is great as well. Just a 2 minute walk to macys o 34 th and 7 moinutes to times square and broadway. For the price, a stay here is definitely worth it if you are just exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for an express night / Parfait pour court-séjour”
Reviews.Author: janys001
Reviews.Content: Ideal place for a night, but not in winter. We were not able to close two of the three windows, so when you're in New York the sounds of taxi never stops, so no soundproofing and we did not find the heat. The beds are comfortable, low cost ($ 105 / night), 2 beds, 5 minutes walk from Times Square. Very little space in the room, but minimum stock; bed, sink, television, telephone (wake-up call available). I recommend it if you want to stay a night or two at low cost. No lunch. We were able to get our room at 9:00 in the morning, early check-in. Would stay there again because of the hotel, everything is very accessible. _______________________ Endroit idéal pour une nuit, mais pas en hiver. Nous n'étions pas en mesure de fermer 2 des 3 fenêtres, donc, quand vous êtes à New York, les sons de taxi ne s'arrête jamais, donc pas d'insonorisations et nous n'avons pas trouver le chauffage. Les lits sont confortables, faible coût (105 $ / nuit), 2 lits, 5 minutes à pied de Times Square. Très peu de place dans la chambre, mais stock minimale ; lit, évier, télévision, téléphone (wake-up call disponible). Je vous le conseilles lorsque vous voulez séjourner une ou 2 nuits, à faible coûts. Pas de déjeuner. Nous avons pu avoir notre chambre dès 9h00 le matin, en early check-in. J'y retournerai volontier car de l'hôtel, tout est très accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Not great.”
Reviews.Author: sarah b
Reviews.Content: Felt like a dorm room, cleaning staff would come in even with the sign on the door saying Do Not Enter, people steal your food in the community kitchens and the bathrooms (because of the shared aspect) can get a little gross. Great location, just sub par. Won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodation, Fab Location!”
Reviews.Author: graceyb123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 11th-13th Nov, after having a bad experience with another hostel we had pre booked before our departure. We had to book the Americana whilst in New York, and were concious of budget having already spent money to stay in a hotel for one night after our previous hostel was shut down upon arrival. By this point in our trip we were not really bothered about what accomodation we got, we just wanted something that was reasonably priced and clean so we could rest our weary heads for a while. We decided upon the Americana, and we were NOT dissapointed!!! We arrived into a lovely cosy reception area, and were booked in efficiently. On getting in to our room, the first thing that struck us was how small is was, but the second thing that struck us was how CLEAN it was too. We Had a huge cupboard to put our massive back packs in, and a big sink in the corner with lovely clean towels and soaps underneath the sink. The room was noisy, but as a previous reviewer has said, I dont think anywhere in the city can really be that quiet, its a compromise we were prepared to make to be in a fantastic location.The beds were comfortable too, so depsite the noise, and after days full of walking the streets of New York, we didnt find it too difficult to fall asleep! In fact, the people in the room next to us kept us awake more than the hustle and bustle of the street outside. But dont let that put you off at all.....we felt safe and secure in the room we had. The bathrooms were also very clean, luckily we had one right across the hall from our room, so it was very conveinient, I did also see a large disabled bathroom too, which we used on the one occasion the other bathroom was busy. The cleaning staff do an excellent job of keeping the entire place clean, even the hallway floors are cleaned everyday. The location is EXCELLENT! We were not completely sure of the exact location when we were searching for hostels, but upon our arrival we soon realsied that Byrant park is just a 3 minute walk, (currently they have an amazing christmas market on there), Times Square is also very close, just a few blocks away (if that!) and Macy's and the Empire state are also within walking distance from the Inn. After a very bad start to our stay in New York, with our original hostel being shut down, the Americana Inn really did make the trip worthwhile. In fact, In a way we were pleased that the original hostel was closed down, as this place superseeded our expectations and was probably much better than our original accomodation anyway for not much of a difference in price! Highly reccomend, and we would definitely use this place again if we return to New York in the future. GO THERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Great position and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Matteo R
Reviews.Content: Perfect position, just steps away from Bryant Park and five minutes more to Times Square. The room in which we were staying was very minimal, with two beds and enough space to move around and TV. Of course it was very noisy (because this is NYC, and I challenge you find a quiet place in Manhattan) and not perfectly clean but definitely comfortable. Shared bathroom were indeed super clean and I never had to wait (maybe it's only luck but it's also true that there are many bathrooms to use). For this price and position you can't ask more!

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like a Dorm”
Reviews.Author: John J
Reviews.Content: Security at the front door is questionable (everyone that rings the front door gets in without any further scrutiny). The rooms are small, which is OK for a relatively cheap hotel in NYC, but no charm - felt like a dorm room. The rooms and bathrooms were fairly clean but still smelled funny (our room smelled like a locker room - a disturbing mix of cleaning solution and smelly feet). The bedspread felt greasy and is probably rarely cleaned. At $250 per night, I expected more - even in NYC. The location is great; near Times Square and Bryant Park.

Reviews.Title: “Super depressing”
Reviews.Author: NoneNamedYet
Reviews.Content: The pictures posted here are of the better rooms. Good if you're 19 years old and on an adventure around the world, with only a few bucks in your pocket and lots of friend. Otherwise, stay away. One of the more depressing low-budget experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean & top location!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingSam04
Reviews.Content: Shared bathroom was clean, room was small and basic, but had a TV and vanity. Cheap enough for a New York hotel if you just need somewhere to sleep. Top location only a short walk to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: lisab0864
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location (blocks from Times Square, 5th Avenue) for exploring Manhattan. We had a Twin Twin room and it was tiny -- approx 1 foot between beds and beds were pushed against the walls) but was clean. Would definitely have an issue with paying $160 ($180 for our extra night) for the room if it wasn't in NYC. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - cheap for the area - clean”
Reviews.Author: personallyme
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night. It was one of the better hotel values in the area. The bathroom and shower is shared, but we never had to wait to use it - so no problems there. The rooms are clean and a little small. But the price is right. I would stay there again. If you speak Spanish they are very accommodating as well - fluent in both English and Spanish. This hotel is closeby to lots of things in Manhattan. No frills here, but that's what I expected. I'd stay here again. They have some discounts for local attractions - we did the NBC tour, kinda fun, and got a couple bucks off.

Reviews.Title: “No problem”
Reviews.Author: BabelBrit
Reviews.Content: This is one of the more basic hotels we've stayed in but do not be put off. It's very clean indeed and although bathrooms are shared, you honestly wouldn't know it. There are also basins in the room. Restaurants abound for all tastes. Good price, quite acceptable. Air con a bit noisey, but we didn't need it on all night.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and a huge bargain for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Viggiano
Reviews.Content: Great location. Small but clean room with a nice sink. The shared bathrooms were very clean and always available. You can go everywhere from the hotel. I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: EYUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, we arrived hours before check in time and were given the key to our room straight away. The rooms are small but are exacly as pictured, so knew this when booking. The room was cleaned daily, fresh sheets, towels and soap when needed for the in room basin. The shared batthrooms were always clean and we never waited to use them. The hotel is in a good location, a few miniutes walk to time square and other attractions. The only one slight issue, as this hotel is on the corner of 6th Avenue, we did sleep with the aid of ear plugs. This was not a major issue but wouldnt have been able to sleep though the night without them. This hotel also offered a baggage hold and on each floor there is a kitchen with fridge and microwave. Overall this was a great priced, good loacted hotel. Would book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Jan0705
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. Clean, basic accommodations. Twin bed (just me), flat screen TV, sink in the room, a basket of towels with soap and shampoo. Yes, the bathrooms are shared. For me, no problem because I was never in the room, instead, out exploring NYC. Would recommend for "no frills" travelers. Convenient to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Only in NY could they charge this much.”
Reviews.Author: Adventursaurus
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in NY and would not have paid more than $50 for this room in any other metro area. The room was very small with no frills and a shared bathroom with no ventilation. The bedding was horribly old, to the point of falling apart at the touch. The blanket felt like Styrofoam and the comforter had what looked like a knife cut in it. The only entertainment was a 12" tv mounted to the wall. We tried to stay out.as long as possible. Location is the only saving grace.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Rodoco
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. We stayed here in January and it was perfectly adequate. Staff were friendly and helpful. Location was perfect, and I'm sure still is ;). Rooms were tight but well priced and clean. I'd recommend staying here if your on a budget and have reasonable expectations.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back (stole this title from TA, LOL)”
Reviews.Author: Meyem
Reviews.Content: Just spend 7 nights in the Americana with my niece. I’m a budget traveller and I chose this location for it’s proximity to Bryant Park and was not disappointed, only a 2 minute walk to this little haven of peace in hectic New York. We were upgraded to a 3 bed room, which for this hotel means a pretty large room! I already posted other pictures earlier and yes, rooms can be pretty cramped. I’m giving this hotel 5 stars, though, but that is keeping in mind it’s only a one star hotel and we got a pretty good deal, booking it early on a slight discount, and got a wonderful upgrade as mentioned! Actually, after reading all the reviews I was surprised at the little street noise we experienced. Nothing spectacular, really. Sure, we both used earplugs, but that only drowns noise a little….guess we were both too tired, though I did spend 1 or 2 nights staying up late working on the pc. No internet in the rooms, as stated, but Bryant Park offers free wifi which is perfect as long as you sit in one of the corners. The park did close at 11 PM, to my surprise. Pillows were fine though not overly thick, beds a little squeaky, nice firm mattresses (which is how I like them). We experienced no noisy neighbours at all, but that’s always a matter of luck, I think. No carpets, so no dirty stains, fine by me! Yes, the bathrooms could be damp, as there was no airing system…but when I share bathrooms, I make a point of wearing flipflops at all times! They were clean, though, and water pressure and temperature was good. About 4 or 5 to each floor, only one with a window… As for the bedding, the linen was fresh and clean, the blankets thin and indeed had holes in them…they did seem clean to me. There was a flatscreen tv, but we never had in on, so I can’t comment on that. We could actually get on to the fire escape, which we did once to have some tea and it was great fun! Luckily, we also had a functioning airco, as the outside temperature was well in it’s 80’s! Boy, it was hot in NY that week! As one NY-er we got talking to said: ‘you picked the worst weather ever to visit!’ He was right, of course, but we still had a wonderful trip and the last 2 days the weather gods had some mercy on our souls… There is a small elevator, no fan or airco inside, so with these temperatures: a free sauna was included. It stops on the second floor at any time, so we opted to take the steps from that floor and back…..I have to admit, not the fastest elevator I know….we sometimes took the stairs down not to get too hot…but, as I mentioned, weather conditions were extreme! Fire plans, extinguishers, alarms, escapes, all seemed to be in perfect order. Every floor had one kitchen with a microwave, a cooking device and a fridge. No utensils. There is a lovely little deli across the street, run by Chinese, where you could get great stuff (warm food after 11 AM, I think) to take to the park and have breakfast or diner. A small diner across the street which was fine (prêt-a-manger right below, but we didn’t try that), a lovely diner 2 blocks away, Moonstruck at 38 x 4th Ave, absolutely worth a visit! And of course a Pax at the corner of Bryant Park, so no need to go hungry. We loved our stay, and I would love to stay here again! But: it is a budget hotel, so don’t come expecting the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean but worn around the edges, not the best night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: youngish
Reviews.Content: Pros: Can't beat the location. We flew into Islip and took the train to Penn Station. You can easily walk to the hotel from there. From the hotel we walked to times square, a show off-broadway - the location can't be beat. Clean bathrooms (shared), Frindly/helpful front desk staff. Cons: It was rainy and muggy and we had no air conditioner in our room to cool off and remove the dampness from the air. We cracked the window to cool off but that only made it more damp. Mattress was sagging/hard, pillows very thin, bedding worn/holes in blanket (but it appeared clean). Linoleum floor in room, no scatter rugs etc. No bath mat provided and the bathrooms have a drain in the middle of the floor and they are constantly wet. (Bring flipflops for bathroom trips/showering). Noisy hallways (lots of echo when people talk, tote luggage, open/shut doors). No internet. It looked as if they were getting ready to put window units in some of the rooms- but not ours. Call ahead to make sure you've got AC if the weather is going to be warm. In a nutshell, great for tourists who just need a clean/safe place to crash for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: sub34439
Reviews.Content: Caution! Had to call 911 for people fighting outside my room. Front desk did nothing but knock on their door and ask if all was ok. DUH! I was terrified! When I demanded a refund that morning I was told the 3rd shift offered to change my room which never happened! I was told they couldn't refund my cost! While I was talking to the desk about this 2 woman and another couple said, are you complaining about all the noise last night?!" They checked out and went to another hotel! On top of that the first night I had to ask for clean sheets! There was hair on mine! When they gave me sheets to change my own bed I found pubic hair on that set! The bathrooms are not connected to the room which isn't a big deal, but people slamming doors are. Front desk was not helpful at all, couldn't care less about complaints, condescending. I would not recommend this hotel to a friend OR enemy. Do not stay there if you want sleep and safety.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RyanF30709
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed their on our first trip to New York. The room was adequate a little small though, this was known when we booked. There were no unpleasant surprises clean sheets and towels daily. Perfect place for the budget traveler a no frills hotel. The bathrooms were very clean, they are shared no big deal enough to share. Staff friendly everything went smooth. Get familiar with the subway we did and went everywhere from Coney Island to Queens. Never took a cab or "red bus". Don't be scared learn it and have fun don't be afraid to ask someone they are'nt going to mug ya!! Bring earplugs all hotels will get some street noise. Eat street foods when ever possible espicailly in Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good price.”
Reviews.Author: JulD
Reviews.Content: Overall nice place to stay in if you think about the location. Very clean shared bathroom, corridors and room was ok. No bedbugs. However, very noisy at night, but we were so exhausted that we slept very well with earplugs. The room was cold but ok with the heater that was in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Bring ear-plugs, tiny rooms, shared bathrooms. Eerie corridors.”
Reviews.Author: El_Predator
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in single room. Venting means window can never be fully shut so can be noisy. Smaller than I hoped for the price but I guess that NYC. The cheapest of the OK-range in downtown NYC. Affordable but you get so much more for the same money in other hotels around the world. But thats NYC I guess. No bed-bugs for me.

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep, nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Correct
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel. It's a place to sleep and store your suff while you are shoping and enjoying NY. I booked two rooms via hotels.com and while a check-in they could only find one reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: langar612
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location. We were close enough to walk nearly everywhere in the tourist area of Manhattan (Times Square, Grand Central, Rockefeller Center, etc.), and there are subway entrances just a few blocks away. As two females who'd never been to New York before, safety was a priority. We never felt unsafe, even at night. We were also unsure about how the shared bathrooms would work, but we never waited for a bathroom once. The bathrooms were kept extremely clean. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, especially when we needed to leave our bags at the hotel after check-out but before our flight. The rooms were small, but that was expected & not uncommon for New York. The beds were very firm and bedding needed updating, but after walking around the city all day, we were generally too tired to notice.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but Friendly & Clean”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel4424
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law and I stayed here for 3 nights while we were in town visiting family. The location is great - it's within walking distance to Times Square & the Empire State Building. We walked back to the hotel at night & felt completely safe with the neighborhood. The room is a bit tiny, but I think that's exptected for NYC. The beds were a little uncomfortable, but honestly we were so tired from walking around all day that we still slept just fine. :) The staff was very friendly. We had no issues with the shared bathrooms at all - we never had to wait for one to be open & they were very clean. Overall, it was a great value for the location & I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD BUDGET ACCOMODATION FOR SHORT STAY”
Reviews.Author: DerryGreyhound
Reviews.Content: Just back from a four night say in The Americana Inn. It was my first time in New York and I spent much time researching affordable acccomodation. I booked through the hotels own website and got it for 150dollars a night taxes included,excellent for Manhattan prices. The hotel is in a great location,clean and near all the main sights for a first time traveller. We arrived at Penn station and walked to the hotel in about 10 minutes. The rooms are very small and after 2 days it started to feel claustraphobic. We had a lot of shopping and there is only a small closet with two hangers to store everything. The shared bathrooms are no problem as they are always available and clean. I am not sure if I would stay here again due to how basic the rooms are but if you are looking to do New York on a budget for a few nights this place is ideal. Don't expect too much and you won't be disappointed. Personnally if I was to go again I would prefer to pay a few dollars more for a bigger room or perhaps stay away from midtown and try accomodation downtown or uptown as it is cheaper and everywhere is easily accessible by subway. Loved New York-Top of the Rock awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great loaction, perfectly adequate rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rodoco
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New York. The Americana is in a great location, only a few blocks away from the Em[ire State and from Time Square. The area feels perfectly safe and is probably best described as a business district. There are a number of coffee shops and small delis near the hotel. The room was clean and comfortable. The only drawback was the shared bathroom, but there were a number of them on each floor and they were very clean. Id be happy to recommend this place to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN BUT INCOMPETENT”
Reviews.Author: Kagakiwi
Reviews.Content: I'll start off with the good things first. The location is superb, and the price is a fair bit cheaper than anything else in the area. The hotel is very clean (no bed-bugs!) and the communal bathrooms were also very clean and never busy. The bad: we booked two nights here, directly to the hotel. No agencies, no middlemen. And when we arrived, the hotel had NO record of us at all. This is why I always carry printed-out confirmations, and booking it directly meant they couldn't make the excuse that it was the agency's fault. No, it was entirely and completely their own. And we had the proof. They were also full, so after making us wait in the small and rather stuffy lobby for ages we were finally able to have a room. A single room, for two adult males. With a rollaway, there was literally only just enough room for the two beds, as the room was tiny. The desk clerk graciously permitted us to have this rollaway for NO extra charge! So generous! When it was their own fault in the first place that we were being squeezed into a shoebox! So in summary, while this hotel has several features to recommend it, it fails in one of the core aspects of running a hotel: keeping track of reservations (not even a discount as apology). It is about half the price of the Marriott brands across the street, but I would think very carefully about staying here. Oh, and while our room was nice and quiet, as it faced a brick wall, the air-con in the window made a huge racket. Next time I will choose the Marriott over the road if I want to stay in this part of New York. It's only about twice the price, and almost certainly twice as good. And run by people who know how to keep track of reservations....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: wicorthered
Reviews.Content: Price won't be beaten really good for Midtown Manhattan. The room was very basic but was bigger then I'd imagined and very clean. Shared bathrooms but they were spotless and always free. Just 10 minutes away from Penn station it is very easy to get to from JFK. Location really couldn't have been better 5 minutes from both the Empire State Building and Times square with the Rockefeller building, MSG and Grand Central easy walking distance. 5th avenue is also at your doorstep. Street noise was loud at night but I'd imagine most midtown hotels would be. Service wasn't exactly helpful not rude or anything just not very friendly. Couldn't open our window and room got quiet warm at night but there was AC so not too bad. If like us your hotel is simply for a few hours sleep its the perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Olympia_Deb
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Americana three times and would definitely recommend it. The price can't be beat, and it is immaculately maintained. Best of all, walking distance to bus, train, theatre, Times Square, shopping, etc. Ask for a higher floor, the 2nd floor is pretty noisy. Although you are sharing a bathroom, there are several on each floor so I think I've only had to wait once or twice.

Reviews.Title: “value and location”
Reviews.Author: carelbotha
Reviews.Content: User friendly hotel in a great location. If you are budget-conscious this place is perfect. Rooms are small but ours was next to the bathroom and clean on the 3rd floor. Shared bathroom was always neat and available. Very convenient location on 6th ave. Only negative point is that the room wasn`t ready at 4pm.

Reviews.Title: “Rodents here...”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyandJohn
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a 24 hour flight from Australia and checked in around 8.30pm and were greeted by Dan in a friendly, polite manner. Our room was on the fifth floor and we noted that the mini kitchen and bathrooms were all very clean. Unfortunately we encountered a rodent in the corridor and with visions of rodents sharing our bedroom beat a hasty retreat and checked out by 9pm. I must say that Dan was most helpful, apologetic and understanding and organised an immediate refund for me.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ThinController
Reviews.Content: The Americana Inn provides amazing value in a great location. It is less than 10 minutes walk from Penn Central station, and is very centrally located within New York City, only a few blocks from the Empire State Building. I stayed two nights in September. The hotel was very clean. The office (on the 2nd floor) offers guests use of a safety deposit box to store valuables. There is a payphone in the 2nd floor lobby, as well as a drink vending machine and a single computer with paid internet access (either credit card or cash). I was in a single room on the 5th floor, and there are a few things for prospective patrons to note to assist with their stay: * The hotel has vinyl floors, * The rooms do not have a coffee maker - but you are next door to Pret a Manger and there is also a great deli diagonally opposite, * With shared bathrooms I would suggest bringing thongs (flip flops). As other guests have noted the bathrooms are very clean. There were at least 4 bathrooms on my floor. Unlike several other reviewers, I did experience one occasion when three of the bathrooms were being used - I think everyone wanted to have a shower at the same time! * While a washbasin is provided in the room, there was nowhere to hang your towel (other than over the back of the chair), * There was no lamp in the room, with all the lights controlled by a switch at the door. I would therefore suggest bringing a torch, * While toiletries, towel and floormat are provided in your room for use in the shared bathroom. no facecloth was provided, * There is no desk provided in the room, but the chest of drawers can double as a desk if needed, * No iron or ironing board is provided in the room (I did not ask at the desk if one was available), * No guest information is provided in the rooms, and * The single lift can be very slow. I only used it to bring my luggage up to the 5th floor when arriving and back down when leaving and used the stairs for the rest of the time. The above items are not meant as criticisms and did not detract from my stay. As several other guests have noted downtown New York is noisy at night, but after all it is the city that never sleeps (except seemingly at 7:00am when going out to get breakfast). I did not find the airconditioner particularly noisy even though it was mounted right above the bed head - it probably made less noise than my wall mounted unit at home! The deli diagonally opposite made great bagels with cream cheese for breakfast. As noted above Pret a Manger is next door and adjacent to Pret a Manger is another deli. The souvenir shop around the corner (corner of 39th and 6th) sells stamps, and there is a post box right outside the shop. The internet booking price of $145 per night (plus taxes) was excellent value for money for central New York, and I would definitely stay here again if visiting New York. TC

Reviews.Title: “Great value (price, location, friendliness, convenience and cleanliness)”
Reviews.Author: gaylem50
Reviews.Content: I stayed in 3 different hotels in NYC in August and as far as I am concerned this was the best value for a single traveller. The only negative that I can think of was the traffic noise, but hey it is NYC and I was there to sightsee, so I just got out and about. Even though I shared a bathroom, I never had to wait to use it and it was always clean. Internet in the lobby was convenient and the service was friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again. Flat screen TV was a great bonus.

Reviews.Title: “clean, budget accomodation in great location”
Reviews.Author: Doughnutty
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and arrived after hours and had no issue with reception, the staff were friendly enough. The small elevator was very hot & stuffy but thankfully because there are not too many floors you don't have to stay in it for long. Our room was on the top floor with a 'view' down onto the intersection of 6th & W38th. With the window closed it was a fairly quiet room (except maybe the air cond)... quiet enough for NYC. I actually found the sound of cars driving by, car horns being tooted and the somewhat annoying sound of the shop across the road's high pitched advertising jingle all part of the experience of being in NYC. The room itself was tidy & a comfortable size. With the fantastic city all around you, I doubt you'll need a bigger room anyway. There were plenty of bathrooms on the floor; we were closest to the disabled. The bathroom was okay. It was cleaned each day, but there was something about it that you just wouldn't spend a long time in there. The city... What can I say about the city? After we arrived and settled in, it was about 10.30 - 11.00 PM and we decided to hit the lights of Time Square which was within a nice, comfortable walking distance. On our way out, we bumped into some other Aussies who were staying on our floor and they pointed us in the direction of TS. The Inn is also close to Bryant Park where we spent a few mornings eating breakfast & enjoying the cool breezes & watching the New Yorkers make their way to work. There's just so much to say about NY, I loved this city. We spent one night walking on foot around the precinct of our hotel and when we mapped our parameters when we got back to our room, what seemed like blocks and blocks of walking was in the grand scheme of things, not far at all... There’s so much to see, you’ll be preoccupied for days. The weather was near on perfect at this time of year. There was a slight coolness in the morning, but beautiful sunny weather for the rest of the day. Overall, I would recommend Americana Inn to anyone looking for a clean, budget accommodation in a great location. Writing this review makes me want to be back in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Boots_n_All_84
Reviews.Content: Having searched for reasonably priced accommodation, my husband and I eventually settled on The Americana Inn in New York City. The hotel is around 7 blocks from Penn Station, not easy to navigate with big bags so be prepared for weaving through pedestrians and traffic if coming from the station. The room we were given was really small, only just enough room for our bags and us! There was a basin in the room which was helpful as we had opted for the shared bathroom. The room was clean, nothing fancy. The only complaint I have is the aircon unit in our room - it was so noisy and woke me up often. However, apart from that, not too bad. The location is pretty central - a couple of blocks to Times Square and Broadway. Don't expect luxury and you'll be fine!

Reviews.Title: “definitely YES!”
Reviews.Author: the_real_Holly
Reviews.Content: Despite the previuos comments - AC WORK! Beds are clean and comfy.The location is perfect. For those who is going to shop, Lord and Taylor is right round the corner, Macy - a few streets away. Lots of diners and deli shops around. One night there were no single rooms and i was given a big one with 3 beds for the price of a single.It got a good view on the 6 Ave. If you prefer a quiter room, please note that your window view will be a brick wall. single rooms are really small ((( on the trird floor there was no hair dryer, unfortunately. But i think if you contact a concierge, the problem will be solved. One concierges is Dan - he is really a great professional. Advise: if you reserve the room in advance, please bring a print out with you. The system may lose your reservation but you will be given a room with the rates on ur print out.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but GOOD”
Reviews.Author: scildos
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at the Americana, this was our first hotel on a 3 week road trip down the east coast of America stretching from New York to Key West, on first seeing the hotel as we arrived we thought we had made a grave mistake on the choice of places to stay in New York, but we were wrong to judge a book by its cover,the staff are really friendly and helpful, the hotel is very clean inside and the rooms, although small, are kept immaculate by the cleaning staff, as are the communal areas, this hotel doesn't have ensuite in any of its rooms but there are plenty of bathrooms on all levels to accomodate all guests, it can be a little noisy when trying to sleep as it's on the junction of 38th st and 6th Avenue, but I challenge anyone to find a quiet hotel in mid town Manhattan, it is ideally situated for all the main attractions in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but Horribly Hot and Stuffy”
Reviews.Author: Lauraloha
Reviews.Content: After an exhaustive search and a cancellation at The Jane, I chose the Americana Inn for it's price and double bed, rather than bunk beds. I got the room a couple dollars cheaper on Priceline. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The place is immaculately clean and the aesthetic is nice. Excellent coffee shop across the street, walking distance to everything, subway close. The shared bathrooms were not a problem, they were dirty once or twice, but not for long, they clean quite frequently. Now, the problem. And why I will NEVER stay here again. It was so freaking HOT and stuffy we could not sleep without the window open (earplugs needed) and the door to our room OPEN so there was cross ventilation. Yes, that's right, we slept with the door open to our room. There was no choice. There is absolutely NO ventilation system in the entire hotel. To their credit, I did ask the front desk about this and he pointed to a air conditioner mounted on a board behind him. He said that they were in the process of outfitting all the rooms with AC. Please double check this before booking. Do NOT stay here in the summer without AC, you will be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely happy”
Reviews.Author: jemimagrace
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel by opening the yellow pages & finding the cheapest-sounding hotel (I didnt have internet at the time of booking). Paying $80 a night, I wasnt expecting much but I was really happy. Although the room was small, and the lack of carpet made me feel like I was in jail, it was pretty clean, and the hotel was quiet. I had a TV, sink & closet in the room, and the bathroom was roomy, with a shower and toilet. The bathroom was a little unclean however, but I think I used it just before the cleaning ladies came, because the next time I went in it was spotless. The front desk staff were very nice, and there was a soda machine and an internet-connected computer for free use in the lobby. The location is perfect for travellers, 2 minute walk to Bryant Park, 5 mins walk to Times Square/Empire State Building/Penn Station/Grand Central, 2 mins from Subway, right on 5th Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: DavidZA
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy about the Americana Inn but it does the job, clean, cheap, and the location is perfect; just a few blocks from all the main sights of NYC. We booked the cheapest room possible as we weren't planning on spending any time in the hotel beside sleeping so our room didn't have its own bathroom which I wasn't keen on; but it worked out fine, the shared bathrooms are clean and there was no problem with availability. The rooms are small but clean, more than adequate for our needs. If you're a light sleeper I recommend taking ear plugs as the road outside can get a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: “New York Night”
Reviews.Author: debbiek7
Reviews.Content: We started at another hotel, but it was less than habitable, so we ended up at the Americana and it was affordable, close to all of the attractions, and clean. It is within steps of David Letterman's studio.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ransom1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Americana Inn for four nights in February. Just some helpful tips: The hotel is on the corner of 6th ave and 38th street, on 6th you will see a blue sign above a cafe on the corner with the hotel name, then turn the corner to 38th st and the hotel is just a couple doors down, with a green door, press the buzzer to enter. The lobby is one floor up, there is an elevator and stairs, I think there are about 5-6 floors. The lobby has a vending machine for drinks and a stand for pamphlets that have coupons for attractions in the city. We stayed on the 2nd floor, which if I were to do it again, I would ask for a room on a higher level and for a room with a view. The main floor just has too much commotion with cleaning staff and the elevator dinging at all hours. But there are about 15-20 rooms and 4 bathrooms per floor which was never a problem for us, I would suggest using your do not disturb sign when going into the washroom because people tend to try to open the door before knocking. The room itself was small for two people but it was enough for the price. There is a little closet with hangers, a desk, chair, sink, and mirror. The cleaning staff bring fresh towels every day and tidy the room. I would recommend bringing a wash cloth or loofah to help scrub off the layers of sweat from walking in the city. There is free cable in your room which is awesome. The walls are super thin so you can hear everyone walking around and the cleaning staff are really loud in the morning, try a higher floor and maybe it wouldn't be a problem. Overall the hotel was pretty nice, if you're looking for a place to keep your stuff and crash for the night, this hotel works. It is right near bryant park and times square, its within walking distance to central park, its a great location especially for the price. If you're on a budget but want to have fun exploring the city, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good bang for your buck!!”
Reviews.Author: colo77
Reviews.Content: Tis hotel is well located, in the heart of new york, everything is close by,,,the rooms are average what you could expect for a budget hotel, but clean! service from the staff was very helpful, i stayed during the NYE so it was pretty busy but the staff always found time to help out, overall is well located is cheap but clean and the staff is helpfull. (bathrooms are not inside the rooms but we never had to wait, there is like 5 batrooms per floor)

Reviews.Title: “Good for budget minded travelers”
Reviews.Author: tkoczor767
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay without going completely broke in NYC---stayed here recently for the third time and absolutely love this "little tiny hotel" It is worth the money, rooms are clean, bathrooms are in the hall but very clean (5 bathrooms to every floor in a 5-story building), never had to wait in line for bathroom. Was noisy from outside streets---but hey, NYC is the city that never sleeps anyway. Could ask for an inside room that is somewhat helpful. Soap/shampoo/towels included everyday by cleaning staff. Like the convenient kitchenetts with fridge and microwave. Staff is very friendly and helpful; got my needed wakeup call at 4:00 am; and luggage held in office after checkout. Was appreciative of honest staff: friend lost white bathrobe---by accidental pickup upon room cleanup---reported to staff and was located by housekeeping and returned! Hotel highly recommended, look at this hotel as my "timeshare" away from home.

Reviews.Title: “mildew and pubic hair but close to times square”
Reviews.Author: krawner
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near Times Square and all the touristy action. It's also on a major intersection and is a low-rise building, so expect lots of noise when you're sleeping. The window was broken which made for a cold breezy evening in November. (Heat not yet on). The bathroom had lots of mildew and pubic hair. It was the same pubic hairs from one day to the next. Do they not clean? I am a big fan of low budget places and hostels, but I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central, friendly but with tiny rooms and very loud traffic noise”
Reviews.Author: mejvt
Reviews.Content: The Americana Inn is close walking distance to the subway and is in a safe neighborhood with cafes and the amazing Little Korea (with delicious Korean BBQ restaurants) nearby. The room and shared baths were very clean, but the twin/twin room was MUCH smaller than the picture shown on the website - the 2 twins were literally about a foot apart with no nightstands. The front desk was friendly and helpful and the hotel felt to be kept secure. One major drawback was the road noise from our room which faced the intersection of 6th and 38th - I expect noise in the city but the windows were not able to be tightly shut and as a result it was almost as load inside as outside - bring earplugs! And overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: pedroessy
Reviews.Content: Hot, smelly, dirty and not even that cheap. Avoid like the plague

Reviews.Title: “Clean but basic, a place to chill for a while..”
Reviews.Author: panda223
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for six nights and let's be honest, if you're expecting luxury this is not where you would find it. BUT the hotel is clean and basic and has most everything you need for a budget stay in the city that never sleeps. The bedroom on the top floor had twin beds, a shared bedside table, a small closet with about 6 hangers in and a sink with a light on. My biggest gripe was NO mirror in the room which was a bit annoying with two girls getting ready every morning. Saying that though, the shared bathrooms were normally very clean (obviously when they had just been used they got a little mucky- but the maids were excellent and kept them clean every day!) It would have been nice to have paper towels to dry hands or soap to wash hands because you hardly remember to take a towel every time you go to the toilet. The shower wasn't very powerful and did stop randomly a couple of times - but did turn back on after a couple of minutes and was hot and fine. Also there were no worry about getting into the bathrooms because you could always nip to another floor you were stuck. Overall it was clean and basic. Little touches like paper hand towels in bathroom, and a mirror in the bedroom would have made it even better, but for the price you can't really complain. Asked for a hairdryer at reception every morning and got one and used a safety deposit box behind reception too which was fine. Lift was kinda HOT and a bit slow, and slightly annoying because it dinged a lot. Air con handy when we stayed because wass very warm but could not really leave it on all night because was very noisy. NYC is the kinda place which you expect beeping horns and trash being broken up in the night so just expect it and take it in as the city experience. Location very good for hotel- minutes walk from good midtown attractions- do the Rockefeller Centre at night very pretty and enjoyed Madame Tussauds in Times Square. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel i've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: alexontour
Reviews.Content: horrible, smelly, noisy, dirty, unfriendly. shared bathroom was grim dreaded going back here at the end of the day spent a few more bucks to go 3 star

Reviews.Title: “Lovely budget hotel - recommended.”
Reviews.Author: CharlieBarley
Reviews.Content: This is really good value. It's fairly basic, with shared bathrooms but this is common in NY anyway. There was a sink in our room and towels, shampoo and shower gel provided. It was very clean and the staff were good. We didn't use the kitchen but i think they were pretty basic - it's as cheap to eat out as do a supermarket shop here anyway! For a central location and good price, so long as you're not wanting anything too big or fancy, this is worth a look - we'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Bad.”
Reviews.Author: ZBatalden
Reviews.Content: We booked the Americana as a last resort due to planning our trip at short notice. This Hotel is in Mid-town which is a decent neighbourhood in manhattan making it easy to access the other parts of the city. The hotel is about 3-5 blocks from the subway depending on which subway station you choose. Also, another note worthy thing that is not mentioned anywhere is that people live in this hotel. We had no creepy or weird experiences with the residents of this building but having residents in the same building as a hotel is something worth mentioning so people booking it are at least aware. The rooms are waaaaay smaller than the Pod Hotel which is a comparative price in the same neighborhood. The room is just barely big enough to fit the double bed in the room, a tiny dresser that you couldn't use if you wanted to due to it's proximity to the bed (to close to open the drawers). There is also a closet and small sink in the room. However, there is no mirror in the room making it difficult to apply makeup, or do your hair without going into the somewhat dirty shared bathrooms. The room could not have been bigger than 75 or 80 square feet. It was very difficult for two people to sleep and get ready in this room for two days. The bathrooms were not the worst shared bathrooms i have ever seen but they were not clean. There was other peoples hair all over them. There was also nothing to dry your hands on after washing them. The linens on the bed were clean enough to sleep on without fear and we did not see or feel any bedbugs so that was a plus, i guess. There is no wifi. The man working the front desk was flat out rude. the entire time. I'm not sure if he works there constantly or lives there or something but we only saw him from the time we checked in to the time we checked out and it took some special attempts just to get him to look up at us to ask a basic question. He was sullen, rude and made absolutely no attempt to be friendly or helpful or even remotely civil. In short if you are looking for a budget friendly option in midtown choose something else this hotel sucks.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting ring worm”
Reviews.Author: butterflycry
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend on an affordable trip to NYC for his birthday. I found the state of our room at the Americana Inn to be filthy and DISGUSTING. Upon entering our room, we were horrified to see that they did not run any type of air conditioning or ventilation, and felt our room was musty and uncomfortable. Affordable or not, we were not the slightest pleased with the cleanliness of the hotel. After our short visit, we left feeling disappointed. On our way home that same day, my boyfriend realized he had contracted some sort of rash- all over his body. Thankfully- I did not have any signs of the rash- but I had decided to wear more attire to bed than he had. Unfortunately for him, the rash was all over his body. We were disgusted and mortified at this discovery. We thought out our trip and realized with no air conditioning and a damp and warm room, mixed with poor housecleaning, he had contracted RING WORM. He is currently at the doctors, and I have already made two phone calls to the manager without any type of reassurance or compensation for our troubles. I am completely disgusted and angry at this hotel and their non hospitality. This is lawsuit material and I would discourage anyone from staying at the Americana Inn in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place in the centre of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: NewtoBoston
Reviews.Content: I had extended a business trip by one night and was previously staying at The Hyatt, so it was with trepidation that I approached the Americana Inn. I buzzed the buzzer, and went up the stairs to check in. the guy at reception was very friendly and helpful. The place was like some of the better hostels you see in Europe; the room was sparse but clean. With a decent bed, air conditioning, a TV and sink. When I entered the room, it had just been cleaned so it smelled of disinfectant ... this though didn't go away the whole night (but i would rather have this than cigarette smoke or stale air!) Every floor had around 4 restrooms with showers, and these were spotless. It was also incredibly quiet, no late night door banging. The location was great, round the corner from Macys, the Empire State building and Time Square. I will definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option”
Reviews.Author: CameronandKristy
Reviews.Content: One thing you have got to give the Americana is that you will be hard pressed to find a better located hotel for the price in New York. As far as location goes, you are in the middle of Manhattan. IF you are looking for a clean, simple hotel, this is for you. The shared bathrooms are interesting concepts, each bathroom services about 4-5 rooms, that said I never had to wait to use it in the 5 nights we were here. The hotel is noisy, well the traffic noise is anyway. The rooms that face the road, some have air conditioning but most don’t, being an old building, it gets very hot at night so if you want to sleep, pack ear plugs and get the good ones. Other than that for location it is brilliant for all the New York sights you may want to see on a budget. There is a great deli diagonally across the road and the little Chinese place next door to the deli has the biggest serves of food you are likely to see. The General Tsao’s chicken is worth a visit on its own. Word from the wise, the meal is enough, not starters required, my wife seems to think the meals are big enough to share but you can make your own assessment on that, I am not a great sharer

Reviews.Title: “Great find for budget conscious traveler”
Reviews.Author: SisterChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 8 nights--4 in a two twin bed room with my sister and 4 nights in a double bed room solo. Both rooms were small but adequate with large closet, small sink, and close to shared bathrooms. One room was on the street side, but with AC running, street noise wasn't a problem. As other reviewers have said, the staff is friendly and helpful, the location is excellent, and rates were wonderful at $87 + tax single and $100 + tax double. Rooms and bathrooms were very clean and shared bathroom was always available. Towels, linens, and pillows were fine. Supply of liquid soap and shampoo were available in room. Working TV and AC. Little refrigerator (great for storing breakfast milk, OJ, yogurt) and microwave at end of hall helped keep food expenses down. Nice Indian restaurant around the block on 39th. Three grocery/deli/food shops nearby. Beautiful Bryant Park 2 short blocks away. Easy walk to Times Square and subways. I hope to stay here again on my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in central (midtown) New York”
Reviews.Author: bahumbug
Reviews.Content: My partner and I researched this extensively on TripAdvisor before we left and decided on the Americana Inn. We weren't disappointed, it was great! The staff were friendly (enough) and helpful and the room was cleaned everyday to within an inch of it's life! We knew it would be noisy so we took earplugs which we think all travellers should carry and use when needed. After 3 nights (we were there for ten) we got used to the noise but still needed earplugs on most nights. We knew we were sharing a bathroom toilet (with 3 other rooms) but we never saw anyone else use it and it was always clean (the flush of the toilet is weird though). I couldn't recommend it highly enough and we do recommend it to our friends because for $110 a night it was clean, secure, nice room and bed and everything we had hoped for. If you get a chance to go to New York, GO! It is the best city in the world! If you think you can't afford it, you can! Places like the Americana Inn are affordable yet comfortable and secure.

Reviews.Title: “The room and staff were great, dumpster trucks run in the morning but not on the weekends.”
Reviews.Author: TomExpatriate
Reviews.Content: The staff are great as is the location. 69 W. 38th as everything is close by and or accessible. The dumpster trucks don't run on the weekends, but you can hear them during the week -am. You can crash here very easily. There is a safe at the front desk so that you can store your personals. There is a market across the street, Empire State Bldg two blocks away, Broadway a slight walk, Rockerfeller Plaza and so many other places to visit. The room is small but not tiny. It is bigger than a nice comfortable small room at the Park79. The Americana Inn is clean, close and affordable and the picture does not do it justice as it is in a good area for me. There is Internet here also - Free.

Reviews.Title: “Safe,Clean,Warm,Small,Cheap.Great for lone travellers.”
Reviews.Author: blahblahblaah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Americana Inn in nov 2008. As a 22 year old girl travelling alone, i was so pleased to find you had to buzz to get in the front door and the room could be double locked inside.The staff were sooo friendly and very helpful. Though the weather was very cold out, it was very toasty and warm in my room! My room was very clean and bed was made every day. It wasn't facing on to the road so it was very quiet at night (except i was right by reception so could hear people coming in and out). The shared bathrooms were always spotless and i never had to wait to use one. My only niggle was slight draft in my room coming through the gap where the air con unit was set in the window, but thats it!!! (i just slept at the other end of the bed) It is a great location for a first timer to new york and really great quality and safe place to stay on a budget and i would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “This is a lukewarm review. Stay here only because there's no other choice.”
Reviews.Author: eliihaysee
Reviews.Content: I was in town for just one day. I drove up from Annapolis, and stayed too late into the night to attempt to drive home. So, the event I attended fell somewhere around 38th street. Looked up hotels, found this one that was under $150 a night, parked my car two blocks away @ $25 for the night. I read the reviews and found that it was a bare minimum kind of hotel. You just get a small room, with shared bathroom, etc... The hotel reminded me more of a hostel, with doors and closets. I selected this hotel for the price, and because it was close to what I was in New York to do. The rooms are clean... too clean. Smelled a little like bleach. Bring ear plugs, or noise canceling head phones. The inn overlooks the intersection of 5th and 38th, and the city literally never sleeps. Very noisy. The A/C works, TV barely works. Who goes to NY to watch TV? I couldn't hear the TV over the noise from outside with the A/C on top of it. The shared bathroom isn't too appealing either, but you get what you pay for. Bring soap, and your own towel if you can. Maybe your own pillow too. Actually, you should probably stay across the street at the Marriott. About 5 blocks west, there's a Best Western. The Americana Inn is for non-fussy travelers. I was too tired and drunk to really care about my room for one night. But I was really glad to be tired and drunk because it was the only way that I could sleep in such a noisy room. Wireless internet: you'd be lucky to get it. I tagged onto a weak signal for about 20 minutes in the afternoon. There's an internet station across from the check-in desk. The lobby is on the 2nd floor, and the entrance is hidden on 38th St. Stay there if you're on a really tight budge, if there's no other choice, if you're deaf, or if someone else is paying for it. And bring your own soap and shower shoes. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “The bare minimum, but that's OK!”
Reviews.Author: medcat3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Americana Inn during a conference. The Inn is ideally located and a great bargain. The Inn was clean. As typical for most NY Hotels, the rooms were a bit small. Nevertheless, I recommend the Americana Inn for budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good Price for NY but Very Small Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Beast_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend in early April 2009, we choose this hotel purely on price and location, the price was good for New York and the Location was great, right by Times Square, Empire State Building, and the New York Public Library. What let this place down was the room itself. The rooms are very small and all bathrooms are shared but are clean, the room was not much larger than the double bed inside, with just enough room to store your case. We felt it cramped for two people trying to get ready each morning. The room was very warm and had no climate controls of any sort. Noise from the street was average for a city that never sleeps. I would only stay here if you are on a budget or just need a hotel for a place to lay your head for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, clean hotel and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Laciguru
Reviews.Content: I have been in the hotel for 4 days with my cousin. The location is great. The Time Square is in 2 minutes walking distance. The rooms are really clean and the staff is laid back. Manhattan is loud, but still this hotel was the best choice ever. Brilliant value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Location/Price Great”
Reviews.Author: sb_enfrance
Reviews.Content: Hello, solo traveller, stayed three nights at this hotel. For a in and out room hotel, for budget type, it is perfect. I will kept this adress in my notebook. Just tow things, street noise, and don't use their phone for local calls, you are charge by the time. Use the payphone in their lobby, but beside that, room under $100.00 in N.Y is great

Reviews.Title: “Basic but perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: Memphit
Reviews.Content: Place in within easy walking distance to all the major attractions. Extremely clean both the room and the shared bathrooms. Toliets had a habit of blocking (happened twice in my 5 day stay) but were very promptly fixed once housekeeping was informed. Though the person doing the blocking never seemed to think of this themselves!!! Bit noisey due to its central location but nothing that kept me up or anything. Room very basic - bed, washbasin, draws, closet. Very small but was barely in it so not really an issue. Was meant to have cable tv but I could not get a picture of anything watchable but again thats not what your there for.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for the price & Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ozbang
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday, first timer to NY, and I could'nt fault the hotel. Did not expect this hotel to be the Ritz, so was not disappointed in anyway. I knew what i was paying for a cheap place to keep my luggage and hopefully comfortable beds with clean safe surroundings and somewhere to clean up. I would advise anyone going to NY to use this place, its well worth it. The lobby is on the second floor, and they have to buzz you in to enter. To use the lifts first it has to stop at the lobby, at first i was a bit confused by this, but i suppose its an added security measure to stop any would be thieves, nice approach. Nicely located to 5th Ave shopping, your on 6th ie one block away, Times Square is around two blocks away, and the empire state is 4 blocks away. Grand central is a couple of blocks away blah blah blah. Basically your slap bang in the middle of where you want to be. NY exceeded all my expectations and made for an excellent trip even though in the middle of winter. I'm going back again within the year and you've guessed it, back to the Americana. It can get a little noisy of a night, but stick the telly on or wear some headphones or even ear plugs and you'll get used to it, I'm a londoner so i'm used to a little noise. Found it hard to sleep the first night but the second slept normally, home on the third. Great hotel, could'nt recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: rosie_rosebud
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Americana recently during our first sighseeing trip to New York. We were after somewhere which was central yet didn't cost a fortune, and the Americana ticked both those boxes. The rooms are small, but are immaculately clean with comfy beds and washstands in every room. Although I was worried about sharing the bathroom facilities with other guests, I needn't have bothered, as I never had to wait for a shower or to use the loo, and once again they were lovely and clean. The only thing I could perhaps say is that our room was far too warm. When we asked the hotel staff if there was any way that they could turn down the heat they refused. However all the staff that we dealt with during our stay were polite and helpful. They even booked our shuttle bus back to the airport saving us the job. The airline lost my boyfriend's bag on our arrival in New York, but the staff at the Americana assisted us by giving us a ring when his luggage was eventually delivered. The location really cannot be beaten for the price, only 4 blocks from Times Square and a five minute walk to Fifth Avenue. Oh and the Bryant Deli over the road is fantastic! Not only can you have a hot sandwich or panini, but there is also a super salad bar which also serves hot pasta and noodles and it's open 24 hours a day. All in all the Americana has everything you need for a no frills trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price - Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: joanne-lovesanimals
Reviews.Content: Booked our room through Air Canada. We arrived before the check in time but since our room was ready they allowed us to check in early. When we arrived the elevator was broken but was fixed by the next morning . This hotel has small VERY CLEAN rooms with shared bathrooms, bathrooms were very clean. The bathroom next to our room had a broken shower. We stayed Friday - Wednesday - The shower was broken the entire time. Many bathrooms on our floor so we used another bathroom to shower. Clean rooms, beds very comfortable. Clean, inexpensive, great location, walking distance Empire State Building, Time Square, Byant Park, Madison Square Garden. Great deli just across the street - able to get good inexpensive food and take it back to our room. TV not many channels. The rooms are small, great place to stay if you don't intend to spend much time in your room. This hotel was great for what we wanted. A clean, comfortable place to stay. If you are on a budget - this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice NYC bargain surprise”
Reviews.Author: tjltc
Reviews.Content: You see so many bad stories about bargain hotels in NYC, dirty, bed bugs, unfriendly employees....and to my surprise this is NOT one of them. Rooms are bargain sized, with only the basics, but a comfortable CLEAN bed, and wall mounted flat screen. Sink in room, and shared bath were fairly new, and above average for cleanliness. All employees that I came across were friendly and helpfull. On all three days I passed housekeeping in the hall and was greeted with a smile !!! Location is handy to all NY has to offer by train, and walking distance to Times Square. For a inexpensive get away, where you will be out and about enjoying all that is NYC....this is the place ! Enjoy a great meal or another show with the savings.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but way too much air freshener.”
Reviews.Author: Icefamily4
Reviews.Content: Great location! The Americana Inn was walking distance to most everything we wanted to do and see. There is also easy access to bus routes and subways if you decide to venture farther out. The room was small, but we expected that. The bad part was being on the 5th floor where it was very evident that someone had been regularly smoking on the floor, and that housekeeping was using spray air freshener to cover it up. I am very sensitive to those sprays and it was so bad that I asked to be changed to a different floor. I was told that it was not possible that night and they would move us the next day. Note: They indicated that smoking was not allowed, to which I responded, "you may know that and I may know that, but someone has been smoking, and the awful spray is not the fix". I would have rather put up with the smoke smell. They had no suggestions or remedys to my inability to breath without covering my nose. I slept breathing through a wet cloth most of the 1st night. The next day, we inquired about our move to a new room and we were told that the night person had no business promising us a new room and there was no other room to move us to for the rest of the week. Again there was no suggestions on what I could do other than tell the housekeeping not to use the spray air freshener in our room. We looked into a few hotels in the near vicinity, but one night in those hotels would have been as much as our entire stay at the Americana, and at the time we were not prepared to pay that much. I ended up going to a Starbucks, buying a lb. of freshly ground coffee and a couple of their large filters. Back in the room, I spread a large amount of coffee grounds over a flattened filter and that actually helped cover up the artificial spray. Each day I put out a new filter with new grounds. At least I was able to sleep without covering my nose. I waited to post this review just to give me space not to emotionally rant. I am generally not a hard person to please, I expect that not everything is going to be perfect every time, but I felt that my stay was greatly downgraded by the intolerable smell and lack of remedy by the staff. Thank God for my mother teaching me about coffee grounds being a good deordorizer!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Traveladdict28
Reviews.Content: A former New Yorker of 30 years, I returned to the city for a weekend and stayed at The Americana with my husband in order to attend a few social events. The location is great for anyone who wants to shop/do the typical touristy things (empire state building/broadway/msg) etc. The rooms were well heated, well lighted and well cleaned. The decor is simple, yet appealing. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Clean towels, bedding with extra pillows and a few simple toiletry items were provided. There is a night stand, bureau, closet and sink in each room. Each floor has 4 bathrooms with tub/shower. Nobody was ever in the bathroom when I needed it. There is also a simple kitchen w/ refrigerator, microwave and counter. I almost feel like I should keep this "secret" to myself so that the Americana is available when I return to Manhattan for a place to rest my head. I would ask for a room away from the elevator and not facing 6th avenue if you are a light sleeper. The security is great as there is a camera and they buzz you inside both doors. There are cameras on each floor and in the elevator. You can't beat the price. The photos that they display on their website are accurate. Also, there are 2 great pubs (Irish & Australian) across the street and Bryant Market (on the corner) makes a great egg sandwich for breakfast. The hotel does have a vending machine and brochures/maps etc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Americana Inn, fantastic location - better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Juice6
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic time in New York staying the the Americana Inn. First time to USA and wanted to have a hotel in a great location without payiing the Earth. We were extreamly pleased with The Americana Inn, the location cannot be beat for the price - 5 mins walk south to Macys, 5 min walk to 5th Ave & about 7 min walk to Times Square. Looks like the whole hotel has been re-painted recently, and evrywhere was very clean. The reception is 24hours & there is a elevator. In each room has either a double or 2 twin beds, large sink with mirror, TV, phone & closet. It has maid cleaning service everyday. The rooms are not ensuite but there are 5 bathrooms on each floor between approx 16 rooms. There would always be a bathroom available at all times & always warm & clean. So don't worry about 'padding' down the corridor (maybe only a couple of meters) in the middle of the night! There is also a kitchenette on each floor which is very handy for cold drinks & leftover take-away! There is a PC in the reception for internet & it's only $1 per 10 mins. All the staff very very helpful whenever you needed them. I would recommend this hotel to couples mainly & independent travellers who don't want to waste money on unnessasary hotel costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: nessa_11
Reviews.Content: My stay at Americana Inn dated back to Oct 2003 (the dropdown menu of the year of stay provided only options of up to 2005). First off, the location was great and the recep was friendly. The room i was given was very small but cosy. There was a sink in my single room and the shared bathroom was just right next door. It's pretty clean and well-kept but there were some guests who tended to leave their towels on the bathroom floor after they're done using them. Pity my room did not come with any view except that of the other parts of the building since mine wasn't a street-facing room. There were large trash bins situated along the common corridor where everyone could dispose of their food and junk. This is really convenient for everyone but i definitely did not fancy the occasional visits from the teenie-tinnie nymphs (baby roaches) which came running into my room.

Reviews.Title: “Love it & Hate it”
Reviews.Author: Madmel1983
